profile.profileDescription: This CollectiveAccess profile configuration is compliant with EBUCORE version 1.4.

label.name: Description
label.description: Free-form text or a narrative to report general notes, abstracts, or summaries about the intellectual content of a resource. The information may be in the form of aparagraph giving an individual program description, anecdotal interpretations, or brief content reviews. The description may also consist of outlines, lists, bullet points, edit decision lists, indexes, or tables of content, a reference to a graphical representation of content or even a pointer (URI, URL) to an external resource. A running order can also be provided as a description. For a Radio or television programme a running order can be used as description. A description can be provided in different languages.

label.name: Date
label.description: Dates associated with events occurring during the life of the resource. Typically, Date will be associated with the creation, modification or availability of the resource.

label.name: Type
label.description: The nature or genre or target audience of the resource. Type includes terms describing general categories, functions, genres, or aggregation levels for content. Recommended best practice is to select a value from a controlled vocabulary or classification scheme. To describe the physical or digital manifestation of the resource, use the FORMAT element.

label.name: Type
label.description: Free text to provide type information other than genre or objectType, possibly in different languages defined by the elementTypes lang attribute.

label.name: Genre
label.description: To define the genre categorising the resource. Content genre is often described through more than one single term.

label.name: Target Audience
label.description: The target audience of the resource. Recommended best practice is to select a value from a controlled vocabulary or classification scheme.

label.name: Reason
label.description: The reason, if any, why a particular audience has been identified.

label.name: Rating
label.description: Provide rating values of the resource.

label.name: Source
label.description: Reference to the resource (s) from which the current resource is derived in whole or in part. If no label or number is available, the title and/or the statement of responsibility etc. of the digitized recording is recorded here. For a digitized radio programme the production number is normally given here. The Recommended best practice is to use a unique identifier to identify the physical source that has been used to create the digital resource. In the case of a digitized analogue recording, it is the recording used for digitization which is the source. For commercial recordings the label and number is normally given here.

label.name: Languages
label.description: Identifies languages and their use in the intellectual content of the resource. Recommended best practice for the values of the Language element is defined by RFC 5646. Recommended is the use of a two-letter Language Code (taken from the ISO Standard 639), followed optionally, by a two-letter Country Code (taken from the ISO Standard 3166), preferably expressed using capital letters. For example, 'en' for English, 'fr' for French, or 'en-UK' for English used in the United Kingdom.

label.name: Format Notes
label.description: Free text to provide information on the format.

label.name: Carrier
label.description: The material or physical carrier of the resource. If a file, it should be the carrier format.

label.name: Technical Attributes
label.description: An extension element to allow users and implementers defining their own technical attributes.

label.name: Frame Rates
label.description: The frequency (rate) at which frames are displayed in frames per second.

label.name: Codec
label.description: An element of type codecType to describe a hardware or software implementation of a codec.

label.name: Bit Rate
label.description: The bit rate in bits per second (bps).

label.name: Bit Rate Mode
label.description: To precise if the bitRate corresponds to a 'constant' or 'variable' bitRate. In the case of a variable bitRate, the bitRate is the average bitRate. 'none' shall be used when the information is not available.

label.name: Bit Rate Max
label.description: To express the maximum bit rate in bits per second (bps).

label.name: Sample Size
label.description: The size of each audio sample in bits.

label.name: Sample Type
label.description: The type of audio sample.

label.name: Scanning Format
label.description: An element to define if the frame display mode is 'progressive' (one full frame after the other) or 'interlaced' (even and uneven lines are split into two interlaced frames sent one after the other). 'none' shall be used when the information is not available.

label.name: Scanning Order
label.description: The position ('top' or 'bottom') from which the image has been scanned. 'none' shall be used when the information is not available.

label.name: Noise Filter?
label.description: A flag to indicate if a noise has been used.

label.name: Video Track
label.description: To describe the main features of video tracks such as in mutliview systems.

label.name: Audio Track Configuration
label.description: To describe the audio track configuration. Used to express the arrangement or audio tracks e.g. 'stereo', '2+1', 'surround', 'surround (7+1)'.

label.name: Audio Track
label.description: To describe the track allocation e.g. in conformance with EBU R123.

label.name: Audio Channel
label.description: The total number of audio channels.

label.name: Word Count
label.description: The number of words contained in the document.

label.name: 3D?
label.description: A flag to signal stereoscopic content.

label.name: Coverage Notes
label.description: Coverage is used to show various time and place aspects of the subject of the content. Coverage will typically include spatial location (a place name or geographic coordinates), temporal period (a period label, date, or date range) or jurisdiction (such as a named administrative entity). Recommended best practice is to select a value from a controlled vocabulary (for example, the Thesaurus of Geographic Names) and that, where appropriate, named places or time periods be used in preference to numeric identifiers such as sets of coordinates or date ranges.

label.name: Period Of Time
label.description: Period of Time is used to describe a particular time point or period.

label.name: Location
label.description: Location is used to describe a particular place related to the resource.

label.name: Rights
label.description: An all-purpose field to identify information (rights management statement or reference to a service providing such information e.g. via a URL) about copyright, intellectual property rights or other property rights held in and over a resource, stating whether access is open or restricted in some way. If dates, times, territories and availability periods are associated with a right, they should be included. If the Rights element is absent, no assumptions can be made about the status of these and other rights with respect to the resource.

label.name: Rights Holder
label.description: To identify the person or organisation holding or managing the rights related to the resource.

label.name: Exploitation Issues
label.description: Use to state any other restrictions, such as non-rights ones, e.g. legal. State by media, territory, scope (restriction on whole item or extracts) and possibly language. The presence of this information can be used by asset management system implementing traffic lights like mechanism to signal that content may be subject to particular restrictions to be clarified before exploitation.

label.name: Copyright Statement
label.description: Use to state copyright statements over the resource.

label.name: Coverage
label.description: To express temporal and spatial domains of application of the rights. Specifies e.g. a specific start date, end date or period for the availability of the item or the date from which the rights or exploitation issues apply. It may refer to start dates for the availability of an item that is used within a particular geographical area e.g. broadcast locally, regionally, nationally or internationally, or for web-based distribution. A specific time may also be associated with the date.

label.name: Clearance
label.description: A flag (true or false) to signal is rights have been cleared and the resource can be exploited or not.

label.name: Disclaimer
label.description: Express a disclaimer on liabilities.

label.name: Rights ID
label.description: One or more reference identifiers to rightsID to associate distribution rights with the publicationEvent.

label.name: Contact Details
label.description: The contact details of the manager of the rights of the resource in the organisation.

label.name: Version
label.description: Expresses the version type of the resource.

label.name: Organization Details
label.description: Minimum information providing means to further identify and contact an organization.

label.name: Notes
label.description: A free text note to provide additional contextual information.

label.name: Rights ID
label.description: One or more reference identifiers to rightsID to associate distribution rights with the publicationEvent.

label.name: Publication Date
label.description: The first publication date.

label.name: Publication Time
label.description: The first publication time.

label.name: Publication Channel
label.description: The channel on which the title was first published. An element to provide the name of the distributionChannel through which the publicationEvent has been released.

label.name: Publication Medium
label.description: The medium on which the title was first published. An element to provide the name of the distributionMedium on which the resource has been released.

label.name: Publication Service
label.description: An element to provide the name of the service operating the publicationChannel through which the publicationEvent has been released and the identification of the publicationSource (e.g. broadcaster).

label.name: Publication Region
label.description: The geographical region where publication has occurred.

label.name: Library of Congress Subject Headings
label.description: Library of Congress Subject headings describing this object. To add a new heading simply type the first few letters of the heading and choose the desired one from the displayed list of possible matches.

label.name: Caption
label.description: Short descriptive caption for item.
